results.content:
Most of this is not really a "deep dive" but rather an introduction. There are some topics that are not covered in basic tutorials, but those subjects are merely introduced and not dived into and discussed.

Like most other tutorials, there is too much watching someone code and saying "look what happens" and not nearly enough discussion of the how and the why.

I feel that a deep dive should include the theory or the ideology of how the framework is expected to be used and why things are the way they are. Instead, there are just too many places where the author introduces a feature and demos it without any real discussion.
results.content_html:

I feel that a deep dive should include the theory or the ideology of how the framework is expected to be used and why things are the way they are. Instead, there are just too many places where the author introduces a feature and demos it without any real discussion.

results.content:
I love Vasco's teaching style. His delivery is very precise, clear, and concise. He also has the ability to present complex material in an easily understandable fashion.

As for the course, it provides a comprehensive overview of core Angular functionality. I do appreciate the time the instructor took to teach how parts of the framework work under the hood, including features that are rarely used. This type of understanding leads to a better developer experience.

There are no practice exercises, although you can code along with Vasco. Since I use Angular daily, I don't mind the lack of exercises at all. I see this course more as a reference I can rely upon when needed.
results.content_html:

But that aside, the remainder of the course provided me with a lot of engaging content and a clearer perspective of Angular's ecosystem. Vasco is an amazing instructor and I have learned a lot from him in this course and from his blog posts at Angular University. Thank you very much for your work!

results.content:
I truly recommend this course if you want to take your Angular skills to the next step.
These advanced topics discussed here are going to help you understand the inner workings of Angular and make you more productive because you'll spend less time trying to figure out why your application is not working the way its supposed to.
And the best of all, these topics will never be outdated because they are essential for the whole framework.

results.content: Vasco is amazing, nice teacher, very focused in practical situations.
results.content_html: Vasco is amazing, nice teacher, very focused in practical situations.

results.content:
I use Angular on a daily basis for work, and I was genuinely surprised by how useful the content turned out to be. Vasco does an amazing work explaining the actual core of the framework, which in turn made me realize all the "bad practices" and weird workarounds I did when developing apps in a non-Angular way. And even better, gave me the tools I needed to undestand, build and extend custom tools that have saved me a bunch of time of development.

This is not a "Let's build X thing" kind of course, though. I personally see it as everything the Angular docs were hoping to be, but better. Not only explaining why something works, but more importantly, why it doesn't. It was this ability to force common errors and explain in detail why they happen, and after that, going in detail on how to avoid them or fix them, that I liked the most.

This course is definitely a must buy for anyone who wants to learn Angular. And I know I will be coming back to it any time I need a refresher on both begginer and advanced topics.
results.content_html:
I use Angular on a daily basis for work, and I was genuinely surprised by how useful the content turned out to be. Vasco does an amazing work explaining the actual core of the framework, which in turn made me realize all the "bad practices" and weird workarounds I did when developing apps in a non-Angular way. And even better, gave me the tools I needed to undestand, build and extend custom tools that have saved me a bunch of time of development.

This is not a "Let's build X thing" kind of course, though. I personally see it as everything the Angular docs were hoping to be, but better. Not only explaining why something works, but more importantly, why it doesn't. It was this ability to force common errors and explain in detail why they happen, and after that, going in detail on how to avoid them or fix them, that I liked the most.

This course is definitely a must buy for anyone who wants to learn Angular. And I know I will be coming back to it any time I need a refresher on both begginer and advanced topics.

results.content:
I'm a medior Angular developer and I was looking for a more advanced Angular course to polish my knowledge. I saw that this course was covering some basics but also more advanced topics like change detection so I was convinced this would be the right course for me. 
Well, I did learn some things from it but this course is more like touching the advanced topics on a beginner level. It's probably amazing for any beginner wouldn't get lost hearing these concepts that they wouldn't run into while writing simple applications. But for someone who wants to really dive deep into these topics, this course may not be the most satisfactory.
results.content_html:

results.content: This was a good course. It provided great details on the inner workings of Angular. It broke down some key concepts I have previously struggled with. The one thing I would change is to not mix courses from the free course offered on udemy and the angular university site. It made me question the value of this course a bit.
